This is a film i decided to go and see because I'm a huge fan of adult animation. I quite often find that when a film doesn't evolve around kids in the same way say, Madagascar does, it ends up lacking something. This movie was an excellent balance.

Pierce Brosnan has sipped his last Martini and returns, in an outrageous self-parody, as the aging foul-mouthed boozy assassin Julian — a successor to James Bond — with one foot in the grave. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: “Early Years” (1947) and “Farewell” (1979).
